title: Killing an intentional feeder, when it's obvious they're inting, should be reportable
body:
It is griefing to me. Winning a match because someone on the enemy team decided to int is undeserved. Inters do what they do because they want to tilt their teammates. By killing an intentional feeder you're tilting and infuriating the enemy team at least as much as the inter him/herself. As per the definition of griefing you're using an anspect of the game in an unintended way and intentionally frustrating the enemy team in the process. Same as the inter. Besides, it is unsportsmanlike conduct to exploit any unfair advantage you may get.

Some may say that, especially in ranked, they couldn't care less. Inters exsist only in competitive games because losing is the biggest frustration and they want to make their team lose as a "punishment". I'd go as far as surrendering on the verge of victory, because doing that denies the inter's goal and frustrates him, while relaxing the rest of his team. If inters/trolls can't reach their goal they won't try because they'll know it's not going to work. Such behaviour from all of us would deter such people more than any in-game punishments will.

But I doubt anyone besides me is willing to lose a won 4v6 game and so, inters gonna int.

replies.body: wut? so what you are saying to me is that this dude who is running towards me, autoing me or my turret I should leave him alone because I am "tilting you and your team" sorry but what? I don't care if someone in a wheelchair comes and tries to beat me up I will destroy that person instead of letting it beat me up

> [{quoted}](name=ZephyrDrake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-25T09:12:22.439+0000)
> I don't care if someone in a wheelchair comes and tries to beat me up I will destroy that person instead of letting it beat me up

rofl.

> [{quoted}](name=ZephyrDrake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-25T09:12:22.439+0000)
>
> wut? so what you are saying to me is that this dude who is running towards me, autoing me or my turret I should leave him alone because I am "tilting you and your team" sorry but what? I don't care if someone in a wheelchair comes and tries to beat me up I will destroy that person instead of letting it beat me up

more or less your using the wrong situation to compare this to. this is more or less a mentally challenged person in a wheelchair walks up to you asking you to beat the up and you do it. Great Job you are a terrible person!
I mean, if they keep fighting you gotta defend, but if they just sit there and wait for you to snag the free kill or run it down mid over and over again? Yep. Leave them alone.

> [{quoted}](name=ExpStealer,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-09-25T09:24:59.389+0000)
>
> I mean, if they keep fighting you gotta defend, but if they just sit there and wait for you to snag the free kill or run it down mid over and over again? Yep. Leave them alone.

why? because your feelings? I am getting tilted just thinking about people who would do this just to provoke the enemy and have them banned and it just gives trolls an even bigger tool they can use to completely screw with the game
Not killing him should be reportable. Reducing your chances to win, especially in ranked, is a legit reason for a permaban.

> [{quoted}](name=SonicAF,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-09-25T09:13:19.429+0000)
>
> Not killing him should be reportable. Reducing your chances to win, especially in ranked, is a legit reason for a permaban.

Its already a 4 v 5 at this point so your telling me your not skilled enough to win 4 v 5. i guess winning by cheating is also acceptable because it increases your chances to win. I mean with what your saying not cheating is reducing your chances to win.

You see, when it's a competitive environment, you are supposed to have every single edge over your opponent, unless it's forbidden. Up to the point that if asthma athletes are allowed to dope, we are going to find all the asthmatic athletes in the world to capitalise on it.

you make analogies like they have anything to do with the situation. I do not see so much intentional feeding and since I came back from my 18 month break of league in June I have not seen a single case of intentional feeding. but I have seen is people Disconnecting (obviously DC'd) and people killing the obvious DC. Intentional feeder is crappy and sometimes its hard to avoid killing them, but the Quick 30 second or less DC and someone kills that player that is not cool at all no matter what you say.
Nobody said it's cool, but not doing it is assisting the enemy team. Should not ever happen.

So when the enemy Jhin DCed due to momentary lag during the EBT the referee should've just said "IDC, it's your problem; not letting the enemy ADC get a free kill would be assisting you" and just turned a blind eye to the whole situation? Or are you going to tell me sportsmanship and *fair play* only apply to tournaments and nowhere else?
Reducing your chances to win? HA, good try.
What the fuck? I should be reported for trying to win?
Love how people twist my words so they fit their agendas ðŸ˜‚

That's what it is. It is the opposite of griefing brother. Sorry you got someone who decided to int on your team but don't blame the enemies for simply taking advantage and looking to close out the game. When someone does that I would rather the game be over as quickly as possible rather than playing a literal 6v4 for 30+ minutes
The inter was on the enemy team and I didn't take one kill from her whenever she inted (because she took turns inting and trying to win so she can reset her Gold worth).
hey a free kill is a free kill

> [{quoted}](name=Jeddite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-09-25T10:00:53.875+0000)
>
> From 85-IQ minds come terrible 85-IQ suggestions

is the community really this low?
are we really shaming each other cause we don't like what they said.
a well constructed argument you have there.
I feel bad for the OP so I came in here to throw my support. These people think winning is winning even when its given to you, so throwing out insults is a good way to win for them.

Okay listen, people already report about dumb things okay. I yell MID LANE IS BEING PUSHED and get reported for flaming. I tell someone to stop being toxic when they tell me to die, they report me for being toxic. But imagine.. just imagine if this was reportable. I charge a squishy thatâ€™s vulnerable in lane? YOU KILLED A FEEDER >:(((  I jump someone as Camille? YOU JUST KILLED A FEEDER >:(((( I will stop playing league if this gets put in i swear please no

That's the "people" factor. Probably it will happen, but I doubt it would change anything. I was around when the fake "Unskilled Player" report category existed. I know the pain, but what happened when they removed it? More or less "Intentional Feeding" took its role because the dumb kids wouldn't ever understand the difference between a bad player and an inter.

Eventually the feeder will be worth so little gold it won't mean much.

If people ignore the feeder, the feeder will hit them forcing them to kill the feeder or die to the feeder, resetting his kill gold. I wonder which one both you and they would prefer?
You don't have a gold reset feeder, they don't embarrassingly die to a feeder.
Except the feeder knows that too - they'll stop at some point just to get an assist which will also reset their Gold worth and start feeding again.

Takes longer to do that, and all u have to do is ditch him.

It's what I get my teams to do. Hell if they announce the feed in champ select I pick tahm just so I can spit him into them if he tries to play dirty.

Spit him out, run away. Have a real teamfight
There's only so much you can do. I don't touch obvious DCs in lane for example since I know how it feels to have a shitty connection, but they'll die eventually to minions and the like anyway.

By killing an intentional feeder you&#039;re tilting and infuriating the enemy team at least as much as the inter him/herself. As per the definition of griefing you&#039;re using an anspect of the game in an unintended way and intentionally frustrating the enemy team in the process. Same as the inter. Besides, it is unsportsmanlike conduct to exploit any unfair advantage you may get.
> 
> Some may say that, especially in ranked, they couldn&#039;t care less. Inters exsist only in competitive games because losing is the biggest frustration and they want to make their team lose as a &quot;punishment&quot;. I&#039;d go as far as surrendering on the verge of victory, because doing that denies the inter&#039;s goal and frustrates him, while relaxing the rest of his team. If inters/trolls can&#039;t reach their goal they won&#039;t try because they&#039;ll know it&#039;s not going to work. Such behaviour from all of us would deter such people more than any in-game punishments will.
> 
> But I doubt anyone besides me is willing to lose a won 4v6 game and so, inters gonna int.

I don't why you are down voted so much, people are truly disgusting. This is supposed to be a skill game so people taking advantage of this by killing someone who is intentionally feeding is gross. Do you know how many times I have walked away from a DC'd person and not killed them all the time. What is the point of winning a game if it is given to you? There is no good feeling about winning a fixed game. Now I have not had a true Inter in a long time in my games, but when people kill a DC'd person that is the truly disgusting thing as well. and I mean Obviously DC'd standing still even after being attacked. Those are the most disgusting kind of people and whoever does that is truly someone who needs help.

Exactly my thoughts. But don't worry, you'll get downvoted yourself.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} {{sticker:cass-cry}}

I dont care I know what I say is the right thing. These people need these "free" wins too much to try and have a real competitive match. whats the point in winning when its given to you. its like getting aids so you can get positive test results.

It's the typical case of people wanting change, but not wanting *to* change. When there are feeders/afks/trolls on the enemy team - wooo, I'm so glad I'm getting a free win, but if it's the opposite they'll be yelling on the Boards/Reddit or elsewhere about how the community is so toxic and Riot can't fix it. Well, sorry to break it to you, but Riot can't enter anybody's head and forcefully change their mindset. Not to mention you're part of this community too, and as long as you capitalize on the enemy team's "scumbag" disadvantages, you're a part of the problem.
So when an inter comes to my turret, im supposed to ignore that sweet gold that i will get from killing him? LOL try again buddy.
If they intentionally come to feed you, yep. And if you enjoy winning in an unfair way - joke's on you.

> [{quoted}](name=ExpStealer,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2018-09-25T11:20:24.016+0000)
>
> If they intentionally come to feed you, yep. And if you enjoy winning ~~in an unfair way~~ 

Fixed that for you.

> [{quoted}](name=Smokin Penguin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H03yM1dz,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-09-25T11:09:31.139+0000)
>
> So when an inter comes to my turret, im supposed to ignore that sweet gold that i will get from killing him? LOL try again buddy.

Takes a lot of skill to kill an intentional feeder, cant wait to see you in LCS.

II am not salty. I don't think people should play a game of skill and then take advantage of feeders or in the case i see much more is killing people that are obviously DC'd. IMO there both bad and players that do that must need all the help they can get if they are that desperate.

If killing intentional feeders was bannable, I'd have been banned years ago. I'm never going to turn down free gold. And if ending the match quicker frees the enemy team from playing with that wanker, it'll be a mercy.
"Ending the match quicker" can happen if you surrender at the 20 minute mark too, unless you can beat them faster than that.
Well Im not gonna surrender for the enemy team if they have an inter. I'm just going to kill the guy over and over and get fed and try to end it for them as quick as I can.

As I expected. Could've guessed your response even with a quarter of my brain working. If you wanted to end the match ASAP so the enemy team doesn't have to suffer you wouldn't care at all if it results in you losing or winning. You'd just surrender. But we both know it has nothing to do with it and you just proved it. It is what this game has turned into - victory at any and **all** costs... If I didn't know better I'd assume your life depended on it.
Yea man, Im not going to lose for you. So... enjoy! You can have the last word, I'll surrender that for you at least.
Hah, either you edited that comment or mods removed it, like mine ðŸ˜‚

I agree
I share your frustration, but this is not a good solution to the problem.
